properties.name: Athina
properties.description: Posted by Funkymonkey11592 Athens is one of the world\'s oldest cities. Its recorded history goes back 3,000 years. Athens is a popular city of the arts, learning, and philosophy. It is the birthplace of many influential philosophers such as Socrates.

properties.name: Berlin, Germany
properties.description: Posted by Funkymonkey11592 The Berlin Wall was built shortly after World War 2. It was built to separate East Berlin from West Berlin. Many people tried to flee from East Berlin to the West. Anyone who was caught trying to escape was shot to death.

properties.name: Boca Grande
properties.description: Posted by Funkymonkey11592 Boca Grande is a beautiful island. Many generations of the Bush family have gathered here over the holidays. One of the most popular attractions is the Boca Grande lighthouse which was built in 1890. It has been turned into a museum featuring displays about the Calusa Indians and the first Spanish settlers.

properties.name: Good Ole
properties.description: Posted by Funkymonkey11592 New York City was an important trading post while we were under British rule. During the American Revolutionary War it was a main base for British Operations for more than seven years. In 1789 our first president was inaugurated here at Federal Hall. This was the capital of the U.S. until 1790.

properties.name: Montreal
properties.description: Posted by Funkymonkey11592 The area now known as Montreal was once occupied with the Algonquin, Huron, and Iroquis tribes. The European Jacques Cartier first founded the region while he was searching for a passage to Asia. Seventy years later Samuel de Champlain tried and failed to create a fur trading post here. It was finally established as a city in 1832.

properties.name: Paris
properties.description: Posted by Funkymonkey11592 The Eiffel Tower was built as a part of the International Exhibition of Paris in 1889. It was celebrating the end of the French Revolution. It was named after Gustave Eiffel. He used to the tower to measure the speed of the wind shortly after it was built.

properties.name: Qatar
properties.description: Posted by Funkymonkey11592 Qatar has been used as a Persian Empire trade route. It connected Mesopotamia and the Indus Valley. In Al-Bida, Shaikh Isa Bin Tarif built a wall to the sea from both the East and the West. He did this to keep the Al-Sudan tribe from invading. My cousin Amanda is flying as I write this to go and live here for the next two years. She is a physiciatrist.

properties.name: San Francisco
properties.description: Posted by Funkymonkey11592 In 1776 the Spanish settled the tip of the peninsula. They established a fort at the Golden Gate. In 1848 the California Gold Rush moved the city into a rapid growth. There was a major fire and earthquake in 1906 destroyed the city, but it was quickly rebuilt.

properties.name: Title
properties.description: Posted by Funkymonkey11592

properties.name: Tokyo
properties.description: Posted by Funkymonkey11592Location Emperor Meiji renamed Edo to Tokyo. Tokyo means "Eastern Capital". In 1871 the fedual han system is demolished and is replaced by the prefectural system. In 1972 the Prefectural system expanded to include the 23 wards.

properties.name: london
properties.description: Posted by Funkymonkey11592 Queen Elizabeth played a powerful part in transforming England into one of the most powerful nations in the world. King Henry the seventh and King Henry the Eighth also were powerful leaders. William Shakespeare was a talented playwriter who moved to London in the late 16th century. He wrote many well-known plays such as Romeo and Juliet and Ceasar.
